event.title: the Spanish conquests in the Americas, what is now

data.event: After the Spanish conquests in the Americas, what is now the province of Veraguas was awarded to Columbus’ grandson Luís, who launched several expeditions to subdue the native population and firmly establish control.

event.title: made the Spanish captain Francisco Vázquez, survivor of a dramatic El Dorado expedition, its first governor in 1560

data.event: The Spanish crown then established the Province of Veragua and made the Spanish captain Francisco Vázquez, survivor of a dramatic El Dorado expedition, its first governor in 1560.
